column4: How can I capture the output of ffmpeg to a file? ffmpeg > log does not work, nor does ffmpeg >> log
the output of ffmpeg?
yeah, the text that it outputs about the conversion process.
be specific, what your full command is, what you are trying to do, etc
try ffmpeg 2&1> out.txt
ehh sorry the & should go just before the >
add 21&> out.txt
and #bash would be more helpful for your kind of question
that does make it go to the logfile, but the very last line of the log is "Unable for find a suitable output format for '21'" which is a ffmpeg error
ffmpeg -i /home/rixth/file.mpg -acodec mp3 -ar 22050 -ab 32 -f flv -s 320x240 -y /tmp/converter.mpg 21&> out
mind the quotes, and check #bash
when I check the log is says "bash: ffmpeg -i /home/rixth/file.mpg -acodec mp3 -ar 22050 -ab 32 -f flv -s 320x240 -y ~/converter.mpg: No such file or directory" going to bash now...
it cant find a library
I know that much =) But why would only one user her it?
because he or she (yes...) might not have the right library path set
how can I set the paths?
i.e that library might be in /usr/local and that might not be in LD_LIBRARY_PATH, an environemntal variable
anywyays, I hope my answer helped
instal gnome support
my fonts are still not available.
#openoffice ?, try irc.gnome.org
I know about that. Non-free formats (mov, wmv etc) play fine. But the free ones do not.
read what I sent you
I have ben to that page multiple times.
